intro: Melampyrum romanicum, commonly known as the Romanische touch-me-not, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is an annual herb characterized by its slender stems and erect growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface. It is typically found in disturbed soils and open habitats across Europe and parts of Asia.
